title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Ramon Hernandez
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Richard Andrade
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Michael Evans
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: I want to say I‚Äôm sorry for the things I‚Äôve done and I hope I‚Äôm forgiven. I don‚Äôt hold nothing against no one ‚Äì Everyone has treated me well and I know it‚Äôs not easy for them ‚Äì That‚Äôs all, I‚Äôm sorry.

name: Chester Wicker
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Larry Smith
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: Tell my mother I love her and continue on without me. God bless her. Tell the guys on death row to continue their struggle to get off death row. That‚Äôs about it.

name: Randy Woolls
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: Goodbye to my family; I love all of you, I‚Äôm sorry for the victim‚Äôs family. I wish I could make it up to them. I want those out there to keep fighting the death penalty.

name: Kenneth Brock
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: I have no last words. I am ready.

name: Rudy Esquivel
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: Goodbye to all my friends; be cool. Thank you for being my friends. Give my love to everybody.

name: Jay Pinkerton
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: "Be strong for me," Pinkerton told his father, Gene Pinkerton, as witnesses entered the execution chamber. "I want you to know I‚Äôm at peace with myself and with my God," Pinkerton said. He recited a prayer to Allah, the supreme being of Islam. "I bear witness that there is no God but Allah. With your praise I ask for forgiveness and I return unto you," Pinkerton said. "I love you, Dad."

name: Jeffery Barney
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Charles Bass
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: I deserve this. Tell everyone I said goodbye.

name: Charles Rumbaugh
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: D.J., Laurie, Dr. Wheat, about all I can say is goodbye, and for all the rest of you, although you don‚Äôt forgive me for my transgressions, I forgive yours against me. I am ready to begin my journey and that‚Äôs all I have to say.

name: Henry Porter
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: I want to thank Father Walsh for his spiritual help. I want to thank Bob Ray (Sanders) and Steve Blow for their friendship. What I want people to know is that they call me a cold-blooded killer when I shot a man that shot me first. The only thing that convicted me was that I am a Mexican and that he was a police officer. People hollered for my life, and they are to have my life tonight. The people never hollered for the life of the policeman that killed a thirteen-year-old boy who was handcuffed in the back seat of a police car. The people never hollered for the life of a Houston police officer who beat up and drowned Jose Campo Torres and threw his body in the river. You call that equal justice. This is your equal justice. This is America‚Äôs equal justice. A Mexican‚Äôs life is worth nothing. When a policeman kills someone he gets a suspended sentence or probation. When a Mexican kills a police officer this is what you get. From there you call me a cold-blooded murderer. I didn‚Äôt tie anyone to a stretcher. I didn‚Äôt pump any poison into anybody‚Äôs veins from behind a locked door. You call this justice. I call this and your society a bunch of cold-blooded murderers. I don‚Äôt say this with any bitterness or anger. I just say this with truthfulness. I hope God forgives me for all my sins. I hope that God will be as merciful to society as he has been to me. I‚Äôm ready, Warden.

name: Charles Milton
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: There‚Äôs no God but Allah, and unto thy I belong and unto thy I return. I want to continue to tell my brothers and sisters to be strong.

name: Jesse De La Rosa
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Stephen Morin
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: Heavenly Father, I give thanks for this time, for the time that we have been together, the fellowship in your world, the Christian family presented to me (He called the names of the personal witnesses.). Allow your holy spirit to flow as I know your love as been showered upon me. Forgive them for they know not what they do, as I know that you have forgiven me, as I have forgiven them. Lord Jesus, I commit my soul to you, I praise you, and I thank you.

name: Doyle Skillern
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: I pray that my family will rejoice and will forgive, thank you.

name: Thomas Barefoot
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: When asked if he had a last statement, he replied, "Yes, I do."I hope that one day we can look back on the evil that we‚Äôre doing right now like the witches we burned at the stake. I want everybody to know that I hold nothing against them. I forgive them all. I hope everybody I‚Äôve done anything to will forgive me. I‚Äôve been praying all day for Carl Levin‚Äôs wife to drive the bitterness from her heart because that bitterness that‚Äôs in her heart will send her to Hell just as surely as any other sin. I‚Äôm sorry for everything I‚Äôve ever done to anybody. I hope they‚Äôll forgive me. "Sharon, tell all my friends goodbye. You know who they are: Charles Bass, David Powell‚Ä¶" Then he coughed and nothing else was said.

name: Ronald O'Bryan
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: What is about to transpire in a few moments is wrong! However, we as human beings do make mistakes and errors. This execution is one of those wrongs yet doesn‚Äôt mean our whole system of justice is wrong. Therefore, I would forgive all who have taken part in any way in my death. Also, to anyone I have offended in any way during my 39 years, I pray and ask your forgiveness, just as I forgive anyone who offended me in any way. And I pray and ask God‚Äôs forgiveness for all of us respectively as human beings. To my loved ones, I extend my undying love. To those close to me, know in your hearts I love you one and all. God bless you all and may God‚Äôs best blessings be always yours. Ronald C. O‚ÄôBryan P.S. During my time here, I have been treated well by all T.D.C. personnel.

name: James Autry
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: This inmate declined to make a last statement.

name: Charlie Brooks, Jr.
title: Texas Death Row Inmate
date: Statement to the Media: I, at this very moment, have absolutely no fear of what may happen to this body.  My fear is for Allah, God only, who has at this moment the only power to determine if I should live or die... As a devout Muslim, I am taught and believe that this material life is only for the express purpose of preparing oneself for the real life that is to come... Since becoming Muslim, I have tried to live as Allah wanted me to live. Spoken: Yes, I do.I love you.Asdadu an la ilah illa Allah,Asdadu an la ilah illa Allah,Asdadu anna Muhammadan Rasul Allah,Asdadu anna Muhammadan Rasul Allah.I bear witness that there is no God but Allah.I bear witness that Muhammad is the messenger of Allah.Inna li-Allah wa-inna ilayhi rajiun.Verily unto Allah do we belong, Verily unto him do we return.Be strong.

name: Dale Earnhardt Sr.

name: Timothy McVeigh
title: American domestic terrorist

I just can't be any good to you or myself. The pain is overwhelming. Please try to forgive me. Cliff—J. Clifford Baxter.

name: Cameron Todd Willingham

From God's dust I came and to dust I will return - so the earth shall become my throne. I gotta go, road dog. I love you Gabby. (Turning towards his ex-wife and the crowd) I hope you rot in hell, bitch. I hope you fucking rot in hell. You bitches. I hope you all fucking rot, cunts. (Lethal injection starts) That is it.
context: as his final statement prior to his execution by lethal injection. Willingham spent his last moments cursing his ex-wife and the crowd that came to witness his execution. The warden of the prison got so offended that he started out the execution to shut him up and Willingham flipped him the middle finger in response

And all of you men, for living a better life than me, all of you sexually active men, I hate you. I hate all of you. I can't wait to give you exactly what you deserve. Utter annihilation.

name: Ennio Morricone
title: Italian composer and conductor
quote: I, Ennio Morricone, am dead. So I announce it to all the friends who have always been close to me and also to those who are a little far away and I greet them with great affection. Impossible to name them all. But a special memory is for Peppuccio and Roberta, fraternal friends very present in the last years of our life. There is only one reason that drives me to greet everyone like this and to have a funeral in private; I don't want to disturb. I warmly greet Ines, Laura, Sara, Enzo and Norbert, for having shared a large part of my life with me and my family. I want to remember my sisters Adriana, Maria, Franca and their loved ones with love and let them know how much I loved them. A full, intense and profound greeting to my children Marco, Alessandra, Andrea, Giovanni, my daughter-in-law Monica, and to my grandchildren Francesca, Valentina, Francesco and Luca. I hope they understand how much I loved them. Last but not least, Maria. I renew to you the extraordinary love that has held us together and that I am sorry to abandon. The most painful farewell to you
context: writing his final obituary before dying in hospital

I had one of my siblings call me Dave one time in a deleted video from 2016 and it was one of the most successful pranks we've ever done. Thousands of creepy online dudes trying to get overly personal going, "Oh hey Dave, how's it going?" Sorry for selling out so much in the past year, but thanks to everyone that bought hoodies, plushies and channel memberships. My siblings are going to college! Well if they want to, I don't wanna put any dead brother peer pressure on them. But that's all from me. Thank you all for supporting my content over the years. If I had another hundred lives, I think I would choose to be Technoblade again every single time, as those were the happiest years of my life. I hope you guys enjoyed my content and that I made some of you laugh. And I hope you all go on to live long, prosperous and happy lives, because I love you guys. Technoblade out.

They were very stimulating years for me that led me to learn about the world and human nature. Above all, I was lucky enough to meet people who helped me realize what every man would like to discover. Thanks to science and a method that allows us to address problems in a rational but at the same time humane way. Despite a long illness, I managed to complete all my programs and projects (even a small satisfaction; a jazz album on the piano...). But also, sixteen episodes dedicated to schools on environmental and energy problems. It was an extraordinary adventure, experienced intensely and made possible thanks to the collaboration of a large group of authors, collaborators, technicians and scientists. In turn, I tried to tell what I learned. Dear all, I think I have done my part. Try to do yours too for this difficult country of ours. A big hug

name: Aurangzeb
title: seventh Mughal emperor
quote: Wherever I look I see nothing but the Divinity.—I have committed numerous crimes and I know not with what punishments I may be seized.—The agonies of death come upon me fast.—I am going. Whatever good or evil I have done, it was for you. No one has seen the departure of his own soul; but I know that mine is departing.
context: in a letter to his youngest son, Muhammad Kam Bakhsh

name: George Farquhar
title: Irish dramatist
quote: Dear Bob, I have nothing to leave thee to perpetuate my memory but two helpless girls. Look upon them sometimes, and think of him who was to the last moment of his life thine, George Farquhar.
context: to his friend Robert Wilks

name: Marcello d'Aste
title: Italian Roman Catholic cardinal
quote: I wish to die sitting, in tribute to the most worshipful will of my good and precious Jesus.

name: Juraj Jánošík
title: Slovak highwayman known as "the Slovak Robin Hood"
quote: If you have baked me so you also should eat me!
context: refusing to name fellow robbers prior to jumping onto the hook on which he was to be hung

name: Matthew Henry
title: British Nonconformist minister and author
quote: A life spent in the service of God, and communion with Him, is the most comfortable and pleasant life that any one can live in this present world.

name: Anne
title: Queen of Great Britain
quote: Use it for the good of my people.
context: handing the Lord High Treasurer's staff of office to Charles Talbot, 1st Duke of Shrewsbury

name: François Fénelon
title: French Roman Catholic archbishop, theologian and writer
quote: Not my will, but thine be done.
context: quoting Jesus

name: Louis XIV
title: king of France
quote: I'm going, but the State will always remain.

name: William Wycherley
title: English dramatist
quote: Promise me you will never again marry an old man.
context: to his wife. He had married a much younger woman less than twelve days before his death

name: Osei Kofi Tutu I
title: one of the founders of the Ashanti Empire
context: shot to death during war against the Akyem

name: William Penn
title: English writer and religious thinker, founder of the Province of Pennsylvania
quote: To be like Christ is to be a Christian.

name: Charles XII
title: King of Sweden
context: when stepping down from his perch into an entrenchment just as he was shot in the head

name: Joseph Addison
title: English writer and politician
quote: See in what peace a Christian can die.
context: to his stepson, Edward Rich, 7th Earl of Warwick

name: George Smalridge
title: Bishop of Bristol
quote: God be thanked, I have had a very good night.

name: Jack Sheppard
title: English thief and prison escapee
quote: I have ever cherished an honest pride; never have I stooped to friendship with Jonathan Wild, or with any of his detestable thief-takers; and though an undutiful son, I never damned my mother's eyes.
context: prior to execution by hanging

name: Jonathan Wild
title: London organized crime figure
context: prior to execution by hanging

name: Isaac Newton
title: English physicist
quote: I don’t know what I may seem to the world. But as to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore and diverting myself now and then in finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than the ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.

name: August Hermann Francke
title: German Lutheran clergyman and theologian
context: when his wife asked if his Savior was still with him

name: Cotton Mather
title: New England Puritan minister and author
quote: Is this dying? Is this all? Is this all that I feared when I prayed against a hard death? Oh! I can bear this! I can bear it! I can bear it! I am going where all tears will be wiped from my eyes.
context: His wife wiped his eyes with her handkerchief as he said the last words, alluding to Revelation 21:4

name: Anthony Collins
title: English philosopher and deist
quote: I have always endeavored, to the best of my ability, to serve God, my king and my country. I go to the place God has designed for those who love him.

name: Thomas Woolston
title: English theologian
quote: This is a struggle which all men must go through, and which I bear not only with patience, but with willingness.
context: dying while imprisoned for blasphemy

name: Matthew Tindal
title: English deist author
quote: O God—if there be a God—I desire Thee to have mercy on me.

name: Thomas Fantet de Lagny
title: French mathematician
context: responding to the question “What is the square of 12?” on his deathbed

name: Rob Roy MacGregor
title: Scottish outlaw and folk hero
quote: Now all is over—let the piper play 'Ha til mi tulidh' [we return no more].

name: Eustace Budgell
title: English writer and politician
quote: What Cato did, and Addison approved, cannot be wrong.
context: ; his suicide note, written before drowning himself in the Thames. Joseph Addison was Budgell's cousin

name: Turlough O'Carolan
title: Irish Celtic harper, composer and singer
quote: It would be hard indeed if we two dear friends should part after so many years, without one sweet kiss.
context: to a bowl of wine he was no longer able to drink

name: Richard Savage
title: English poet
quote: I have something to say to you, sir... 'Tis gone.
context: unable to remember what he wanted to say to his keeper at Bristol Newgate Prison. The keeper found Savage dead the next morning

name: Alexander Pope
title: English poet
quote: I am dying, sir, of a hundred good symptoms.

name: James Gardiner
title: British Army officer
quote: You are fighting for an earthly crown; I am going to receive a heavenly one.
context: to a Jacobite officer after being mortally wounded at the Battle of Prestonpans

name: Jonathan Swift
title: Anglo-Irish author and cleric
quote: Ah! A German and a genius! A prodigy—admit him!
context: referring to George Frideric Handel, who had come to visit him

name: Simon Fraser
title: 11th Lord Lovat
quote: Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori.
context: quoting a line of Horace when executed by beheading as a Jacobite rebel

name: Nader Shah
title: Shah of Iran (Persia)
context: to one of his assassins

name: David Brainerd
title: American missionary to the Native Americans
quote: Lord, now let thy servant depart in peace.
context: quoting Luke 2:29

name: Isaac Watts
title: English Christian minister, hymn writer and theologian

name: Henry St John
title: 1st Viscount Bolingbroke, English politician
quote: God, who pleased me here, will do what he pleases with me hereafter, and he knows best what to do. May he bless you.
context: to Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield. Bolingbroke also reaffirmed his Deist convictions

name: Mary Blandy
title: English convicted murderer
quote: For the sake of decency, gentlemen, don't hang me high.
context: prior to execution by hanging

name: Joseph Butler
title: English Anglican bishop and theologian
quote: I have often read and thought of that scripture, but never till this moment did I feel its full power, and now I die happy.
context: referring to John 6:37

name: Richard Newton
title: English educator and clergyman
quote: Christ Jesus the Saviour of sinners and life of the dead. I am going, going to Glory! Farewell sin! Farewell death! Praise the Lord!

name: Bernard Le Bovier de Fontenelle
title: French author
quote: I do not suffer, my friends; I only feel a certain difficulty of living.
context: dying at the age of 99

name: Robert-François Damiens
title: French domestic servant, attempted assassin of Louis XV
quote: O death, why art thou so long in coming?
context: during execution by dismemberment

name: Kurt Christoph Graf von Schwerin
title: Prussian Generalfeldmarschall
quote: Let all brave Prussians follow me!
context: just before being fatally struck by enemy fire at the Battle of Prague (1757)

name: Jonathan Edwards
title: American revivalist preacher and theologian
quote: Trust in God and you need not fear.
context: when someone lamented what his loss would mean to the church and to the College of New Jersey

name: William Webster
title: British priest in the Church of England and theological writer

name: Eugene Aram
title: English philologist and murderer
context: when asked if he had anything to say before hanging

name: James Wolfe
title: British Army general
quote: Go, one of you, to Colonel Burton; tell him to march Webb's regiment down to Charles River, to cut off their retreat from the bridge. Now, God be praised, I will die in peace!
context: mortally wounded at the Battle of the Plains of Abraham, on learning that the French forces were fleeing

name: Louis-Joseph de Montcalm
title: French general
quote: So much the better. I am happy that I shall not live to see the surrender of Quebec. I have much business that must be attended to of greater moment than your ruined garrison and this wretched country.
context: on being told the wound he had received at the Battle of the Plains of Abraham was mortal

name: Mary Wortley Montagu
title: English traveler
quote: It has all been most interesting.

name: Madame de Pompadour
title: chief mistress of Louis XV of France
context: applying rouge to her cheeks before her death

name: Jean-Philippe Rameau
title: French composer
quote: What the devil do you mean to sing to me, priest? You are out of tune.
context: to his confessor

name: Frederick V of Denmark
quote: It is a great consolation to me, in my last hour, that I have never wilfully offended anyone, and that there is not a drop of blood on my hands.

name: James Quin
quote: I could wish this tragic scene were over, but I hope to go through it with becoming dignity.
context: English actor

name: François-Jean de la Barre
title: French nobleman
quote: I did not think that they would put a young gentleman to death for such a trifle.
context: prior to execution by beheading for blasphemy and sacrilege

name: Christian Fürchtegott Gellert
title: German poet
quote: Now, God be praised, only one hour!
context: on being told he had only an hour to live

name: Louis Petit de Bachaumont
title: French writer
quote: ("Le prêtre ne put jamais tirer autre chose du mourant que: 'Monsieur vous avez bien de la bonté.'") — The priest could never draw another thing from dying but 'Dear Sir, you are so kind.'

name: Thomas Rutherforth
title: English churchman and academic
quote: He has indeed been a precious Christ to me; and now I feel him to be my rock, my strength, my rest, my hope, my joy, my all in all.

name: Emanuel Swedenborg
title: Swedish theologian, scientist, philosopher and mystic
quote: What o'clock is it?" (On being told) "It is well; I thank you; God bless you.

name: Philip Stanhope
title: 4th Earl of Chesterfield, British statesman and diplomat
context: asking a servant to seat his godson, Solomon Dayrolles

name: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Anglo-Irish novelist, playwright and poet
context: in response to his physician asking if his mind was at ease

name: Joseph Warren
title: American physician and Patriot
quote: I am a dead man: fight on, my brave fellows, for the salvation of your country.
context: mortally wounded at the Battle of Bunker Hill

name: Richard Montgomery
title: Irish soldier, major general in the Continental Army
context: killed at the Battle of Quebec (1775)

name: William Battie
title: English psychiatrist
quote: Young man, you have heard, no doubt, how great are the terrors of death. This night will probably afford you some experience; but you may learn, and may you profit by the example, that a conscientious endeavor to perform his duty through life will ever close a Christian's eyes with comfort and tranquility!
context: to his caretaker

name: Ludwig Christoph Heinrich Hölty
title: German poet
quote: I am very ill. Send for Zimmermann. In fact, I think I'll die today.

name: Nathan Hale
title: American soldier and spy
quote: I only regret that I have but one life to give for my country.
context: before being hanged by the British for his involvement in the American Revolutionary War

name: William Dodd
title: English Anglican clergyman and man of letters
context: to his executioner prior to hanging for forgery. He then whispered something unknown to the executioner

name: Albrecht von Haller
title: Swiss anatomist and physiologist
quote: My friend, the artery ceases to beat.
context: to his friend Dr. Rosselet

name: Nicholas Biddle
title: Continental Navy captain
quote: Bring me a chair; carry me forward; and there the surgeon will dress my wound.
context: wounded in battle between USS Randolph and HMS Yarmouth. While the surgeon was treating Biddle, the Randolph exploded, killing all but four crewmembers

name: Voltaire
title: French writer
quote: Now is not the time for making new enemies.
context: when asked by a priest to renounce Satan before his death

name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Genevan philosopher, writer and composer
quote: Throw up the window that I may see once more the magnificent scene of nature.

name: Augustus Toplady
title: Anglican cleric and hymn writer, author of "Rock of Ages"
quote: No mortal man can live after the glories which God has manifested to my soul.

name: Anne Steele
title: English Baptist hymn writer and essayist
quote: I know that my Redeemer liveth.
context: quoting Job 19:25

name: David Garrick
title: English actor, playwright, theatre manager and producer

name: James Cook
title: British explorer and Royal Navy captain
context: after being mortally wounded by a native Hawaiian

name: Sir Francis Bernard
title: 1st Baronet, British colonial administrator
quote: Never fear; if you will but have patience I don't doubt we shall get through; but take care how you ever get in such a scrape again.
context: dying after epileptic seizure

name: John André
title: British Army officer
quote: I pray you to bear me witness that I meet my fate like a brave man. It will be but a momentary pang.
context: prior to being hanged as a spy by the Continental Army

name: Maria Theresa
title: Archduchess of Austria and Queen of Hungary and Croatia
quote: No, but comfortable enough to die.
context: when her son said, "Your Majesty cannot be comfortable like that"

name: William Ledyard
title: American soldier, lieutenant colonel in the Connecticut militia
quote: I did, sir, but you do now.
context: surrendering Fort Griswold during the Battle of Groton Heights. The British officer to whom Ledyard gave his sword in surrender immediately killed him with it

name: William Hotman
title: American soldier
quote: We will endeavor to crawl to this line; we will completely wet the powder with our blood: thus will we, with the life that remains in us, save the fort and the magazine, and perhaps a few of our comrades who are only wounded!
context: wounded at the Battle of Groton Heights, explaining to a friend how he would prevent the British from igniting a line of powder from the magazine of Fort Griswold

name: Túpac Katari
title: Aymara revolutionary
quote: I die but will return tomorrow as thousand thousands
context: prior to his execution by quartering

name: Pietro Metastasio
title: Italian poet and librettist
quote: I offer to Thee, O Lord, Thy own Son, who already has given the pledge of love, inclosed in this thin emblem; turn on Him thine eyes; oh! behold whom I offer to Thee and then desist, O Lord! if thou canst desist from mercy.
context: after receiving Viaticum

name: John Laurens
title: American soldier, statesman and abolitionist
context: prior to death at the Battle of the Combahee River

name: Charles Lee
title: Continental Army general
quote: Stand by me, my brave grenadiers.
context: dying of fever in a Philadelphia tavern

name: William Hunter
title: Scottish anatomist and physician
quote: If I had strength to hold a pen, I would write down how easy and pleasant a thing it is to die.

name: Anthony Benezet
title: French-American abolitionist and educator
quote: We have lived long, in love and peace.
context: to his wife

name: Denis Diderot
title: French philosopher
quote: The first step towards philosophy is incredulity.

name: Samuel Johnson
title: English writer
context: to Miss Morris, a young woman

name: Frederick the Great
title: king of Prussia
quote: I am tired of ruling over slaves.

name: José Anastácio da Cunha
title: Portuguese mathematician and poet
quote: Je craîndrais de ne pas mépriser assez la vie — some dreams of humanity qui me déchirent plutôt qu'ils me consolent...
context: recorded by Domingos de Sousa Coutinho

name: Christoph Willibald Gluck
title: composer of Italian and French opera
quote: If you wait a little, I shall be able to tell you from personal experience.
context: when asked whether a tenor or a bass should sing the role of Christ in The Last Judgement

name: Charles Wesley
title: English Methodist leader and hymn writer
quote: I shall be satisfied with Thy likeness— satisfied, satisfied!

name: Thomas Gainsborough
title: English painter
quote: We are all going to Heaven, and van Dyke is of the company.

name: Elizabeth Pierrepont
title: Duchess of Kingston-upon-Hull, English noble and courtier
quote: I will lie down on the couch; I can sleep, and after that I shall be entirely recovered.

name: Ethan Allen
title: American patriot and militia general
quote: Waiting, are they? Waiting, are they? Well, God damn 'em, let 'em wait!
context: on being told the angels were waiting for him

name: William Cullen
title: Scottish physician, chemist and agriculturalist
quote: I wish I had the power of writing, for then I would describe to you how pleasant a thing it is to die.

name: Thomas de Mahy
title: Marquis de Favras
quote: I see that you have made three spelling mistakes.
context: upon reading his death warrant

name: Joseph II
title: Holy Roman Emperor
quote: Let my epitaph be, 'Here lies Joseph, who was unsuccessful in all his undertakings.'

name: Joseph Bellamy
title: American Congregationalist pastor, author, educator and theologian
quote: I will tell them for ever that Jesus is precious.
context: when asked what he would do in Hell if God sent him there

name: Benjamin Franklin
title: American statesman and scientist
quote: A dying man can do nothing easy.
context: complaining about the difficulty of assuming a more comfortable position on his deathbed

name: Adam Smith
title: Scottish economist
quote: I believe we shall adjourn this meeting to another place.

name: Johann Bernhard Basedow
title: German educational reformer, teacher and writer
quote: I desire to be dissected for the benefit of my fellow men.

name: John Wesley
title: English cleric and theologian, founder of Methodism
quote: The best of all is, God is with us.

name: Honoré Gabriel Riqueti
title: comte de Mirabeau
quote: Let me die to the sound of delicious music.

name: Selina Hastings
title: Countess of Huntingdon, English religious leader
quote: My work is done; I have nothing to do but to go to my Father.

name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
title: Austrian composer
quote: The taste of death is upon my lips... I feel something, that is not of this earth.

name: Joshua Reynolds
title: English painter
quote: I have been fortunate in long good health and constant success, and I ought not to complain. I know that all things on earth must have an end, and now I am come to mine.

name: Gustav III
title: King of Sweden
quote: I feel sleepy, and a moment of rest would do me good.
context: 13 days after being shot in the back at a masquerade

name: Marie Thérèse Louise of Savoy
title: Princesse de Lamballe, confidante of Marie Antoinette
context: upon seeing bloody corpses in the courtyard where she was then murdered

name: Louis-Michel le Peletier
title: marquis de Saint-Fargeau, French politician
context: assassinated because he voted in favor of Louis XVI's execution the following day

name: Louis XVI
title: king of France
quote: Frenchmen, I die guiltless of the crimes imputed to me. Pray God my blood fall not on France!
context: speaking to his executioners prior to his execution by guillotine

name: Jean-Paul Marat
context: to his wife, after being stabbed by Charlotte Corday

name: Charlotte Corday
quote: One man have I slain to save a hundred thousand.
context: prior to execution by guillotine

name: John Hancock
title: American merchant, statesman and Patriot
quote: I shall look forward to a pleasant time.

name: Marie Antoinette
title: queen of France
quote: Pardon me, sir. I did not do it on purpose.
context: apologizing to her executioner for stepping on his foot prior to her execution by guillotine

name: Charles de Bonchamps
title: French politician and leader of the Royalist Vendéan insurrection
quote: Pardon for the prisoners, Bonchamps commands it!
context: mortally wounded at the Second Battle of Cholet. He was ordering the pardon of five thousand Republican prisoners whom his troops intended to kill

name: Jacques Pierre Brissot
title: French abolitionist and leading member of the Girondins
quote: Rather death than slavery, is the motto of the French.
context: singing these words along with 21 other Girondins before their execution

name: Louis Philippe II
title: Duke of Orléans
context: remembering his former acclaim on the way to the guillotine

name: Madame Roland
title: French revolutionary and writer
quote: Oh Liberty, what crimes are committed in thy name!
context: prior to execution by guillotine

name: Jean Sylvain Bailly
title: French astronomer, mathematician and politician
quote: Yes my friend, but it's from the cold.
context: to a heckler who asked if he was trembling as he approached the guillotine

name: Antoine Barnave
title: French politician
quote: Better to suffer and to die than to lose one shade of my moral and political character.
context: prior to execution by guillotine

name: Armand Louis de Gontaut
title: French soldier and politician
quote: I have been unfaithful to God, to my Order, to my King; I die full of faith and repentance.
context: prior to execution by guillotine

name: Edward Gibbon
title: English historian and Member of Parliament

name: Camille Desmoulins
title: French journalist and politician
quote: Behold, then, the recompense reserved for the first apostle of liberty.
context: looking at the axe prior to execution by guillotine

name: Georges Danton
title: leading figure in the French Revolution
quote: Show my head to the people. It is worth seeing.
context: prior to execution by guillotine

name: Guillaume-Chrétien de Lamoignon de Malesherbes
title: French statesman and government minister, defense counsel of Louis XVI
quote: Hold your tongue! your wretched chatter disgusts me.
context: to the priest prior to his execution by guillotine

name: Élisabeth of France
title: sister of Louis XVI
quote: I pray you, gentlemen, in the name of modesty, suffer me to cover my bosom.
context: when her fichu fell from her neck prior to her execution by guillotine

name: Philippe de Noailles
title: duc de Mouchy
quote: When I was sixty years of age, I mounted the breach for my king; and now that I am eighty-four [sic] I shall not want courage to mount the scaffold for my God.
context: prior to execution by guillotine

name: André Chénier
title: French poet
context: to his friend and fellow poet Jean-Antoine Roucher prior to their executions by guillotine

name: Maximilien Robespierre
title: French lawyer and statesman
quote: Cowards! Why did you not defend him?
context: when blamed for the death of Georges Danton

name: Richard Burke Jr.
title: English barrister and Member of Parliament
quote: His praise, ye winds, that from four quarters blow, / Blow soft or loud; and wave your tops, ye pines, / With every plant, in sign of worship, wave.
context: quoting the Morning Hymn from Paradise Lost to his father, Edmund Burke; he then died in his father's arms

name: Francis Marion
title: American military officer
quote: Thank God since I came to man's estate, I have never intentionally done wrong to anyone.
context: Marion was an enslaver who committed wartime atrocities

name: Louis XVII
title: pretender to the French throne
quote: I have something to tell you...
context: dying in prison custody at the age of 10

name: William Romaine
title: evangelical divine of the Church of England
quote: Holy, holy, holy, blessed Lord Jesus! to Thee be endless praise!

name: Johann Georg Ritter von Zimmermann
title: Swiss philosophical writer, naturalist and physician
quote: I am dying; leave me alone.

name: Adam Naruszewicz
title: Polish-Lithuanian bishop and author
context: referring to his History of Poland

name: Robert Burns
title: Scottish poet
quote: John, don't let the awkward squad fire over me.
context: referring to a Dumfries militia to which he belonged

name: ("Général
title: pourquoi versez-vous des larmes? Je suis hereux de mourir pour mon pays.") — François Séverin Marceau, French general of the Revolutionary Wars
quote: General, why do you shed tears? I am happy to die for my country.
context: to General Jean-Baptiste Jourdan when mortally wounded at the Battle of Limburg (1796)

name: William Bromley Cadogan
title: English clergyman
quote: I thank you for all your faithful services; God bless you.
context: to a longtime servant

name: Mary Wollstonecraft
title: English writer and feminist philosopher
quote: I know what you are thinking of, but I have nothing to communicate on the subject of religion.
context: to her husband, William Godwin, while dying from the effects of giving birth to Mary Shelley

name: Richard Brocklesby
title: English physician
quote: What an idle piece of ceremony this buttoning and unbuttoning is to me, now.
context: as his servants dressed him for bed

name: Christian Friedrich Schwarz
title: German Lutheran missionary to India
quote: Had it pleased my Lord to spare me longer I should have been glad. I should then have been able to speak yet a word to the sick and poor; but His will be done! May He, in mercy, but receive me! Into Thy hands I commend my spirit; Thou has redeemed me, O Thou faithful God.

name: Giacomo Casanova
title: Italian adventurer and author
quote: I have lived as a philosopher. I die as a Christian.

name: John Palmer
title: English actor
quote: There is another and a better world.
context: performing on stage in The Stranger

name: Wolfe Tone
title: Irish revolutionary
quote: I can yet find words to thank you, sir; it is the most welcome news you could give me. What should I wish to live for?
context: when told a wound in his throat would reopen and cause him to bleed to death if he spoke. Tone died in prison under unclear circumstances (possibly suicide) while awaiting execution by hanging

name: Patrick Henry
title: American attorney, politician and orator
quote: Doctor, I wish you to observe how real and beneficial the religion of Christ is to a man about to die.... I am, however, much consoled by reflecting that the religion of Christ has, from its first appearance in the world, been attacked in vain by all the wits, philosophers, and wise ones, aided by every power of man, and its triumphs have been complete.

name: Pierre Pigneau de Behaine
title: French Roman Catholic priest and missionary in Vietnam
quote: Here I am finally. Here I am at the end of the tumultuous career that, whatever my repugnance, I have kept to for so long. My troubles will soon be over and my true happiness is coming, since I have all confidence in the mercy of my God. I willingly leave this world where I have been thought happy in that I have had public admiration, been respected by great, esteemed kings. I can't say that I regret all these honors—it's just that they add up to vanity and trouble.

name: George Washington
title: president of the United States
quote: I die hard, but I am not afraid to go... I am just going. Have me decently buried, and do not let my body be put into the vault in less than two days after I am dead. Do you understand me? 'Tis well.
context: to Dr. James Craik and his personal secretary, Tobias Lear

name: James C. Jarvis
title: United States Navy midshipman
quote: My post is here. I can't leave it until ordered.
context: refusing to leave the rigging of USS Constellation during a battle with French frigate La Vengeance. The mainmast toppled and Jarvis was swept over the side. He was 13 years old

name: William Cowper
title: English poet and hymnodist
context: to an attendant who offered him refreshments

name: Louis Desaix
title: French general
quote: There is yet time to win another battle!
context: prior to death in the French Revolutionary Wars

name: Nicolas Boileau-Despréaux
title: French poet and critic
quote: Do you wish to hasten my last hour?
context: to a playwright who asked him to read his new play

name: Increase Mather
title: New England Puritan clergyman, president of Harvard College

name: John Howard
title: English philanthropist and prison reformer
quote: Suffer no pomp at my funeral, nor monumental inscription where I am laid. Lay me quietly in the earth and put a sun-dial over my grave, and let me be forgotten.
context: dying of typhus contracted on a prison visit in Kherson

name: Baron Johann de Kalb
title: officer in the American War of Independence
quote: I thank you, sir, for your generous sympathy, but I die the death I always prayed for, the death of a soldier fighting for the rights of man.
context: speaking to a British officer after being mortally wounded and captured at the Battle of Camden

name: George Whitefield
title: Anglican cleric and evangelist
context: to a servant

name: Nicolaus Zinzendorf
title: German religious and social reformer and bishop of the Moravian Church
quote: Now, my dear son, I am going to the Saviour. I am ready; I am quite resigned to the will of my Lord. If He is no longer willing to make use of me here I am quite ready to go to Him, for there is nothing more in my way.
context: to his son-in-law

name: Johann Sebastian Bach
title: German composer
quote: Don't cry for me, for I go where music is born.

name: Frederick William I of Prussia
title: King in Prussia and Elector of Brandenburg
quote: No, not quite naked. I shall have my uniform on
context: in response to priest or family members quoting Job 1:21

name: Sally Basset
title: enslaved woman from Bermuda
context: looking at the logs prepared to fuel her burning at the stake for poisoning
